16: ; MaxUser.  The maximum number of simultaneous listeners allowed.
17: ; Compute a reasonable value for your available upstream bandwidth (i.e. if
18: ; you have 256kbps upload DSL, and want to broadcast at 24kbps, you would

20: ; only wastes RAM and screws up your broadcast when more people connect
24: ; Password.  While SHOUTcast never asks a listener for a password, a

19: ; PortBase. This is the IP port number your server will run on.  The
20: ; value, and the value + 1 must be available.  If you get a fatal error when
21: ; the DNAS is setting up a socket on startup, make sure nothing else on the
22: ; machine is running on the same port (telnet localhost portnumber -- if you
23: ; get connection refused then you're clear to use that port).  Ports < 1024
24: ; may require root privledges on *nix machines.  The default port is 8000.
